name: Novotel Gent Centrum

reviews.text: The hotel is situation right in the centre of the medieval old town of Ghent. Prices are reasonable and it is a very standardised hotel. Breakfast is good and you will be eating your other meals elsewhere since Ghent is full of restaurants. Clean spacious rooms. I did not use the sa facility so cannot comment.
reviews.title: Excellent location and good standard

reviews.text: We stayed here on a family trip to Ghent with our two children (6 and 9) -- the hotel is within easy walking distance of all the main sights in Ghent. It's a little difficult to access with the car as it is in the middle of a pedestrian zone, but there is a parking garage (which happened to be full when we arrived). All in all, we were happy with the hotel -- no compplaints
reviews.title: Exactly as expected, and nice location.

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for one night in April. The hotel's location was excellent, right in the centre of Gent, so easy reach to all the local shops, restaurants and bars. There was some building work going on outside the hotel but this did not affect us at all. The hotel has great facilities for a family. My boys especially enjoyed the XBox and Apple Macs in the hotel lobby. The hotel has a lovely outside pool area, we didn't use it as the weather wasn't great, but I would imagine in the summer this would be most welcome for those travelling with family. Our room was what you would expect from a Novotel - clean and comfortable. As we were a family, our room had a double bed and a sofa bed for the children, so there wasn't a lot of space but as we were there for one night, it wasn't an issue. We were unfortunate to have a view of the side ally, although online it states that most rooms have views of the town or the pool area - we were just unlucky I guess! We only booked the night before, so not really a problem. The staff were friendly, the bar and restaurant areas were welcoming. We did not take breakfast, this was quite pricey I felt. All in all, would go back - you know what you're getting for your money!
reviews.title: You get what you expect from a Novotel

reviews.text: I've stayed in the hotel a week. The hotel is in the centre of Ghent, so it is easy to reach all the main places of the city. Rooms were good and quite clean. Service have to be improved. Breakfast is good, but nothing special in comparison with other hotels of the same level. The most disturbing thing was a terrible smell in the reception. Sometimes we could feel that smell in our rooms. In the conclusion, it is not worth to pay 125 euro/night.
reviews.title: Excellent location, service have to be improved

reviews.text: The hotel is located in the heart of Gent's old city. This means that, if arriving by car, a GPS would be a good idea as the area around the hotel is full of pedestrian only areas, one-way streets and banned turns. Watch out for the many cyclists who seem to do as they please.
reviews.title: Location, Location

reviews.text: We have visited Gent a few times before, with and without kids - this was the best hotel for a family we have used by a long way (prevously we have stayed at the Harmony and Marriott). Novotel just seem to get what families need and you never feel that your kids are a nuisance or inappropriate to be there, it is a real relief to be able to travel with children without worrying about whether they are actually welcome! This Novotel is not as stylish as the Suitenovotels, the decor in the rooms is a little basic and tired as others have said, but again with kids its good not to worried about the usual detritus - the rooms are large (we had a suite which is basically two large connecting rooms which was very useful) - the kids corner is useful - and the service was (as mostly in Belgium) friendly and efficient. Breakfast was good - dinner less so as the food was slow to arrive so would not stick to the bar menu in the evenings or eat out. Parking was fine though not a busy time overall it seems. We will be back.
reviews.title: Best for families

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location, even though the construction nearby made it a little difficult to find at first. Our room was nice and clean, but the a/c didn't work. Even when I politely complained at the front desk, nothing was done for us. The beds are very uncomfortable. Breakfast was included with our room rate, and we thought it was very good. The lobby smelled bad for the two days we were there. Kind of a rotten fish/sewer smell. If the a/c in our room had worked, I'd recommend this hotel more highly. We stayed here only because of the a/c, so when it didn't work, we were frustrated that we'd paid so much more to stay here than someplace else. We were not offered a discount or another room.
reviews.title: Good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I like Novotels; the staff are multi-lingual, well-trained and helpful, the rooms are clean, the breakfasts are good value, (other meals are best eaten in more atmospheric surroundings) and some thought has gone into the lighting and artwork in the public areas. But what is the strong smell of sewage doing in reception ? Quite nauseating at check-in,9.45pm, less obvious the next day,so I forgot to mention it to staff. The lift, corridors and bedroom were untainted. Incidentally the Novotel in Bruges has the same mystifying and unpleasant problem, which is a shame as each is ideally situated as a base for city exploring.I will return when I have a cold.
reviews.title: What their best friends aren't telling them?

reviews.text: We stayed in Gent on the 5th May 2012 to watch a football match (AA Gent v Kortjick). If you get off the train at St Pieters you need to get a cab to the hotel (€10) or fram Dam station, again it would be €10. The hotel is next to the main square and near lots of shops and the main catherdral. Staff were friendly and check in was extremely quick. Room was good with seperate toilet and shower, TV, wardrobe space. Rooms are not huge but are adequate. There is also a desk and chair's. Windows open right out in the room. We had a triple room, and it was a OK size for three large men. Breakfast was offered but at €20 we said no thanks. Hotel has a bar/restaurant, but we did not use it. There is also an xbox in the reception. Hotel staff were very friendly and nopthing was too much bother.
reviews.title: Good base for hotel in Gent

reviews.text: As stated we were here for the football. You need to get a taxi to the stadium (about €15) and need one to get back to Gent centre (as we walked back via bars and it was very long).
reviews.title: Great hotel, but beware of beds if you have back problems
Good service in excellent location.
reviews.text: I have sayed at this hotel several times and find the staff friendly and efficient and the location perfect.
Ghent is also know for educational Hub. Novotel is a nice property in the main area.
reviews.title: Must Visit destination when you are in Belgium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are good, yo have to search for the toilets initially, little bit cramped.
reviews.title: Central location

reviews.text: This was our first experience with Railbookers and we were pleasantly surprised with the hotel.Staff were very friendly and hardworking especially the crew in the kitchen. We eat twice and thought the meals were good value. The reception staff could not do enough to help us and we had a lovely welcome. Rooms were wonderful with the advantage of a seperate toilet.They were kept spotless by the chambermaids.
reviews.title: Railbookers holiday

reviews.text: Our children enjoyed the facilities in the foyer. I especially enjoyed the gym where the equipment is of the highest standard, really helped in my marathon training.
reviews.title: Be careful your room is not re let!!!

reviews.text: Finally breakfast had something for everyone, it was mouthwatering. Thanks to all the staff who made our holiday enjoyable, Novotels set the standard. Lots of Keanes
reviews.title: Mixed feelings
Functional, good location and reasonable value
reviews.text: I had stayed a number of times (Accor silver card holder) and was quite happy (apart from the mouse running around the bar). FYI The barman is a great guy. Then I was working late one evening and called the hotel at 2 MINUTES past 6pm and was told my room was re sold!! The receptionist was not very helpful either, so be careful...money comes before loyalty at this hotel.....
Stopped there for a night on our way to France.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service

description: The Novotel Gent Centrum is located in the historic centre of Ghent, close to the tourist attractions and shops. In a modern setting with timeless decor, the hotel features 117 rooms. The bar and restaurant boast a diverse menu in a stylish, warm environment. Depending on the weather, you may choose to dine on the verandah or next to the pool in the terraced garden. This 3 star hotel is perfect for a holiday in Ghent, be it for a weekend or for short stay with your partner or family.
